incidents.name: SMS Outgoing Traffic Impacted

incident_updates.body: The effects of this incident have completely passed through the system and all traffic is operating normally. This incident has been resolved. In addition to the previously described expected error codes of Validity Period Expired (30036) and Twilio Internal Error (30500), a large portion of affected messages were finalized to a Failed status (note Failed not Undelivered) with error code 30008 (Unknown Error).

We continue monitoring remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. However, individual customers may see messages remaining in queues due to large numbers of messages enqueued during this incident. We expect any messages delayed during this incident to have fully propagated through to a final status over the course of the next several hours. Note that we expect that some messages will eventually timeout and fail due to Validity Period Expired (error code 30036), others may eventually fail due to a Twilio Internal Error (error code 30500).
We will provide an update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue monitoring remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. However, individual customers may see messages remaining in queues due to large numbers of messages enqueued during this incident. We expect any messages delayed during this incident to have fully propagated through to a final status over the course of the next several hours. Note that we expect that some messages will eventually timeout and fail due to Validity Period Expired (error code 30036), others may eventually fail due to a Twilio Internal Error (error code 30500).
We will provide an update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue monitoring remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. However, individual customers may see messages remaining in queues due to large numbers of messages enqueued during this incident. We expect any messages delayed during this incident to have fully propagated through to a final status over the course of the next several hours. Note that we expect that some messages will eventually timeout and fail due to Validity Period Expired (error code 30036), others may eventually fail due to a Twilio Internal Error (error code 30500).
We will provide an update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to monitor remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. However, individual customers may see messages remaining in queues due to large numbers of messages enqueued during this incident. We expect any messages delayed during this incident to have fully propagated through to a final status over the course of the next several hours. Note that we expect that some messages will eventually timeout and fail due to Validity Period Expired (error code 30036), others may eventually fail due to a Twilio Internal Error (error code 30500).
We will provide an update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to monitor remaining queued messages. Overall, the system has reached a normal steady state; Now, most messages are sending without any additional queueing delay. incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues within US for a subset of customers

incident_updates.body: Super SIM connectivity issues within the US for a subset of customers have been resolved, and the service is now operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues within the US on the AT&T network. This is impacting a portion of AT&T's network due to a change they made earlier today. We are monitoring the situation as the roaming network works to resolve the issue. If you find your devices are not properly connecting in the US right now you may want to try removing AT&T from your Network Access Profile to see if connectivity improves. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: IOT Network Issues in Africa Due to Fiber-Cut

incident_updates.body: Connectivity issues in Africa have significantly improved for impacted countries. At this time we are observing metrics consistent to those prior to the outage. The issue is now considered resolved.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa

incident_updates.body:
Connectivity issues in Africa have significantly improved for impacted countries. At this time we are observing metrics consistent to those prior to the outage. Please not that there is still reduced capacity on the continent for some countries and this could present itself as increase latency and lower throughput until the issue is fully resolved by the network operators. 

We will continue to monitor and will provide an update within 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa

incident_updates.body: Due to issues with multiple underwater cables that handle connectivity to Africa, connectivity for cellular IoT products, Super SIM and Programmable Wireless, in the region may be severely impacted up to being completely down. Impact and recovery time across networks and countries may vary significantly. Repairs to the cable could take considerable time and service may not return to normal until complete. We will continue to monitor and will provide an update within 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Programmable Voice Insights Call Events, Metrics, and Conference Participant Summaries Delayed

incident_updates.body: The backfill of data is complete and the incident is now resolved.

Voice Insights Call Events and Metrics data is now accessible via the Console and API. We are in the process of backfilling the data for calls that ended on March 18th between 2PM PDT and 10PM PDT. We will provide another update in 4 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to address the delay in the availability of Voice Insights Call Events and Metrics.

We will provide another update in 8 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to address the delay in the availability of Voice Insights Call Events and Metrics.

We will provide another update in 4 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

The delay in the availability of Voice Insights Conference Data has been resolved. We are continuing to address the delay in the availability of Voice Insights Call Events and Metrics.

We will provide another update in 2 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified the issue that is delaying availability of Voice Insights Call Events, Metrics, and Conference Participant summaries for calls placed after 7 a.m. PST today.

We will provide another update in 2 hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating an issue that is delaying availability of Voice Insights Call Events, Metrics, and Conference Participant summaries for calls placed after 7 a.m. PST today.

We will provide another update in 1 hour, or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Voice Insights. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Super SIM API: HTTP 500 Errors on UsageRecord Resource Requests

incident_updates.body:
Twilio's Super SIM API was degraded for 20 minutes between 10:50 a.m. and 11:10 a.m. Pacific Time on 3/19/2024. During this period of time customers observed HTTP 500 errors in response to requests to the UsageRecord resource.

The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Call Failures to a Subset of France Twilio's Numbers

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting inbound calls to a subset of Twilio France phone numbers has been resolved, and the service is functioning normally at this time.

We have started seeing recovery for call failures to a subset of france twilio's numbers. We will continue to monitor to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing Call Failures to a Subset of France Twilio's numbers. We are currently working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing Call Failures to a Subset of France Twilio's numbers. We are currently working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing Call Failures to a Subset of France Twilio's numbers. We are currently working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing Call Failures to a Subset of France Twilio's Numbers. We are currently working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
